DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study twofold : 1 . To understand effect physical inactivity ( sedentarism ) vascular function , insulin resistance inflammation ; 2 . To assess role dietary intervention ( fish oil ) counteracting effect physical inactivity vascular function inflammation .
DOC.brief_title: The Effects Sedentarism Vascular Function , Inflammation , Insulin Resistance
DOC.criteria: Healthy subject : Subjects must free acute , chronic debilitate medical condition . Healthy status establish basis clinical history , electrocardiogram , clinical biochemical screening test blood urine , physical examination , necessary chest radiograph . Any active acute chronic medical problem : Any subject symptom active illness ( e.g. , fever , leukocytosis , hypertension ) exclude study . The exclusion criterion also include history evidence psychiatric disorder , hypertension , diabetes , coronary artery disease ( CAD ) , renal insufficiency , thyroid disease , alcohol drug abuse , viral hepatitis , deep venous thrombosis anemia . Individuals history psychiatric illness psychiatric disorder also exclude , alcoholism , drug dependency include dependency tobacco , major mood disorder major depression manic depressive illness , schizophrenic disorder , anxiety disorder include panic disorder , generalize anxiety disorder , post traumatic stress disorder , obsessive compulsive disorder , agoraphobia , claustrophobia , paranoid personality disorder , schizoid personality disorder , schizotypal personality disorder , borderline personality disorder , antisocial personality disorder . In addition , potential subject first order relative history major depressive illness , manic depressive illness , schizophrenia , agoraphobia panic disorder also exclude entry study . Finally , individual unaware specific psychiatric diagnosis history treat antidepressant , neuroleptic medication major tranquilizer exclude study . However , personal history limit prior counsel psychotherapy ( e.g. , adjustment reaction ) necessarily exclusionary .
